Package co.kr.bluebird.sled

Class Reader

java.lang.Object
co.kr.bluebird.sled.AbstractReader
co.kr.bluebird.sled.Reader
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBarcodeController, IRfidAccess, IRfidConfig, IRfidInventory, ISerialManager, ISledBarcodeController, ISledCommunicationManager, ISledConfig
public class Reader extends AbstractReader implements ISerialManager
Serial reader class.

    • RF_SetRFIDProtocolType

      public int RF_SetRFIDProtocolType(int type)
      Enable/disable Gen2/Gen2X/GEN2_GEN2X protocol
      Specified by:
      RF_SetRFIDProtocolType in interface IRfidConfig
      Parameters:
      type - : Default 0(Gen2),1(Gen2x), 2(GEN2 and GEN2X)
      Returns:
      success : SDConsts.RFResult.SUCCESS = 0
      Condition Error : SDConsts.RFResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7
      Command State Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Connected Error : SDConsts.RFResult.SD_NOT_CONNECTED = -5
      Region Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_ERROR = -1
      * Can receive other error constant of "RFResult" class.

    • RF_SetEnableChannels

      public int RF_SetEnableChannels(int region, String[] channels)
      Sets channel in region
      (In case of this API, Run time during about 0 ~ 8 seconds is required. It sends related callback message(REGION_CHANGE_START(21) - REGION_CHANGE_END(22)) at the beginning and the end.)
      Specified by:
      RF_SetEnableChannels in interface IRfidConfig
      Parameters:
      region - : Target region
      channels - : Target channel table
      Returns:
      success : SDConsts.RFResult.SUCCESS = 0
      Condition Error : SDConsts.RFResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7
      Command State Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Connected Error : SDConsts.RFResult.SD_NOT_CONNECTED = -5
      Region Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_ERROR = -1

      Parameters:
      RFRegion - Import or sets-up history of country-by-country frequency(0 ~ 32)
      (UNKNOWN = -1, KOREA = 0, ETSI = 1, FCC = 2, AUSTRALIA = 3, BANGLADESH = 4, BRAZIL = 5,
      BRUNEI = 6, CHINA = 7, HONGKONG = 8, INDIA = 9, INDONESIA = 10, IRAN = 11, ISRAEL = 12,
      JAPAN_1 = 13, JAPAN_2 = 14, JORDAN = 15, MALAYSIA = 16, MOROCCO = 17, NEW_ZEALAND = 18,
      PAKISTAN = 19, PERU = 20, PHILIPPINES = 21, SINGAPORE = 22, SOUTH_AFRICA = 23, TAIWAN = 24,
      THAILAND = 25, URUGUAY = 26, VENEZUELA = 27, VIETNAM = 28, RUSSIA = 29, ALGERIA = 30,
      EGYPT = 31, CHILE = 32, GUATEMALA = 33, MACAO = 34, NICARAGUA = 35, CAMBODIA = 36, MYANMAR = 37, ETSI_UPPER = 38, PARAGUAY = 39
      Returns:
      Success : Constants.RFResult.SUCCESS = 0
      Range Error : SDConsts.RFResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3
      Serial Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Condition Error : SDConsts.RFResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7
      Command State Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Connected Error : SDConsts.RFResult.SD_NOT_CONNECTED = -5
      Region Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_ERROR = -1
      * Can receive other error constant of "RFResult" class.

    • RF_UpdateRFIDFirmware

      @RequiresPermission(allOf={"android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE","android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE"}) public int RF_UpdateRFIDFirmware(String filepath)
      Updates firmware of RFID radio module
      (In case of this API, Run time during about 90 seconds is required. It sends related callback message(UPDATE_RF_FW_START(23) - UPDATE_RF_FW(24) - UPDATE_RF_FW_END(25)) at the beginning and the end.)
      If it start FW's update, we recommend that do not be call any other cmd.
      Specified by:
      RF_UpdateRFIDFirmware in interface IRfidConfig
      Parameters:
      filepath - File path for RFID firmware update
      Returns:
      Success : Constants.RFResult.SUCCESS = 0
      File path Error : SDConsts.RFResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3
      Serial Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Condition Error : SDConsts.RFResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7
      Command State Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Connected Error : SDConsts.RFResult.SD_NOT_CONNECTED = -5
      * Can receive other error constant of "RFResult" class.

      public int RF_PerformInventoryWithRssiLimitation(boolean turboMode, boolean enableSelection, boolean ignorePC, int rssiLimitation)
      Performs the inventory operation with RSSI Limitation
      Specified by:
      RF_PerformInventoryWithRssiLimitation in interface IRfidInventory
      Parameters:
      turboMode - True : Continuous mode(Duty cycle = 0)
      False : Non Continuous mode

      False : Select disable

      False : The tag data that included PC field
      rssiLimitation - : set rssi limitation. If rssi limitation value is '-60', reader only received tag rssi's range from -30 to -60.(rssi range: -100 ~ -30) RSSI limitation setting disappears when 'RF_StopInventory()' is called.

    • RF_BlockWrite

      public int RF_BlockWrite(int RFMemType, int offset, String data, String accessPassword)
      Allows to writing multiple words in a Tag's Reserved, EPC, TID, or User memory using a single command
      Specified by:
      RF_BlockWrite in interface IRfidAccess
      Parameters:
      RFMemType - The memory bank type
      (0 = RESERVED, 1 = EPC, 3 = USER)
      offset - The offset, in the memory bank, of the first 16-bit word to write.
      data - UNICODE string to write.
      accessPassword - Access password for check (########) : Default 00000000
      Import or set the password to set Tag's Access Permissions HEX Format : WORD(2-bytes) Length.
      Returns:
      Success : Constants.RFResult.SUCCESS = 0
      Memory Type Error : SDConsts.RFResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3
      Access Password Error : SDConsts.RFResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3
      Serial Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Condition Error : SDConsts.RFResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7
      Command State Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Connected Error : SDConsts.RFResult.SD_NOT_CONNECTED = -5
      * Can receive other error constant of "RFResult" class.

    • RF_BlockPermalock

      public int RF_BlockPermalock(int blockPtr, int blockRange, int action, String accessPassword)
      Allows to permalock multiple words in a Tag's User memory with a single command,
      or read the permalock status of the memory blocks in a Tag's User memory
      Specified by:
      RF_BlockPermalock in interface IRfidAccess
      Parameters:
      blockPtr - Only 0 can be specified
      blockRange - Only 1 can be specified
      action - 0 : Retain current permalock setting
      1 : Assert permalock
      accessPassword - Access password for check (########) : Default 00000000
      Import or set the password to set Tag's Access Permissions HEX Format : WORD(2-bytes) Length.
      Returns:
      Success : Constants.RFResult.SUCCESS = 0
      Access Password Error : SDConsts.RFResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3
      Serial Error : SDConsts.RFResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Condition Error : SDConsts.RFResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7

    • RF_BlockErase

      public int RF_BlockErase(int RFMemType, int offset, int count, String accessPassword)
      Erases tag
      Specified by:
      RF_BlockErase in interface IRfidAccess
      Parameters:
      RFMemType - The memory bank type
      (0 = RESERVED, 1 = EPC, 3 = USER)
      offset - The offset of the first 16-bit word, where zero is the first 16-bit word in the memory bank, to erase in the specified memory bank.
      count - The number of 16-bit words to be erased in the tag's specified memory bank.
      This parameter must contain a value between 1 and 255, inclusive.
      accessPassword - Access password for check (########) : Default 00000000
      Import or set the password to set Tag's Access Permissions HEX Format : WORD(2-bytes) Length.
      Returns:
      Success : Constants.RFResult.SUCCESS = 0
      Memory Type Error : SDConsts.RFResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3
      Access Password Error : SDConsts.RFResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3

    • SD_Open

      public boolean SD_Open(String clientId)
      Open SLED, Ready for all communication with specific client feature.(Serial, Barcode and so on) In a multi-processor environment, "SD_Open()" and "SD_Close()" must be executed as a transaction unit. A single processor must call the "SD_Open()" API to initiate a task and must call the "SD_Close()" API after completing the task. This flow should apply equally when app is in the start (resume) and stop (pause) states. The "SD_Open()" API must be called when entering the start (resume) state, and the "SD_Close()" API must be called when entering the stop (pause) state.
      Specified by:
      SD_Open in interface ISledCommunicationManager
      Parameters:
      clientId - R2000 or Exxx String
      Returns:
      Success : True
      Fail : False

    • SD_WakeupFaster

      public int SD_WakeupFaster()
      Wakes-up the SLED Caution : It is possible only on supported RFR901 Series. ex) RFR900(USB-C type) or RFR901...
      (In case of this API, Run time during about 200 millisecond is required. After the operation completed, it sends related callback message(SLED_WAKEUP(47)))
      Specified by:
      SD_WakeupFaster in interface ISerialManager
      Returns:
      Success : Value of the SLED state(SLEEP(0), WAKEUP(1))
      Condition Error : SDConsts.SDResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7
      Other Error : SDConsts.SDResult.OTHER_ERROR = -1
      * Can receive other error constant of "SDResult" class.

    • RF_Close

      @Deprecated public boolean RF_Close()
      Deprecated.
      This api is deprecated, use SD_Close Close SLED, Close all opened communication and unregister many kind of features(Serial, Barcode and so on) If you called RF_Open api, you must also call this api when you close your application. If you don't call this api at this case, it may cause malfunction
      Returns:
      Success : True
      Fail : False

    • SD_UpdateSLEDFirmware

      @RequiresPermission(allOf={"android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE","android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE"}) public int SD_UpdateSLEDFirmware(String filepath)
      Updates the firmware of the SLED
      Do update unconditionally
      (In case of this API, Run time during about 90 seconds is required. It sends related callback message(UPDATE_SD_FW_START(48) - UPDATE_SD_FW(49) - UPDATE_SD_FW_END(50)) at the beginning and the end.)
      If it start FW's update, we recommend that do not be call any other cmd.
      Specified by:
      SD_UpdateSLEDFirmware in interface ISledConfig
      Parameters:
      filepath - File path for SLED firmware update
      Returns:
      Success : Constants.SDResult.SUCCESS = 0
      File path Error : SDConsts.SDResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3
      Serial Error : SDConsts.SDResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Condition Error : SDConsts.SDResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7
      Command State Error : SDConsts.SDResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Connected Error : SDConsts.SDResult.SD_NOT_CONNECTED = -5
      Charging state Error : SDConsts.SDResult.CHARGING_STATE_ERROR = -14
      * Can receive other error constant of "SDResult" class.

      public int SD_UpdateSLEDFirmwareAndDYN(String filepath)
      Updates SLED/Dynamic Profile
      Do update unconditionally

      Updates the firmware of the SLED smartly
      Do update If new firmware binary is newest than current version
      (In case of this API, Run time during about 90 seconds is required. It sends related callback message(UPDATE_SD_FW_START(48) - UPDATE_SD_FW(49) - UPDATE_SD_FW_END(50)) at the beginning and the end.)
      Specified by:
      SD_SmartUpdateSLEDFirmware in interface ISledConfig
      Parameters:
      uri - File path for SLED firmware update
      Returns:
      Success : Constants.SDResult.SUCCESS = 0
      File path Error : SDConsts.SDResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3
      Serial Error : SDConsts.SDResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Condition Error : SDConsts.SDResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7
      Command State Error : SDConsts.SDResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Connected Error : SDConsts.SDResult.SD_NOT_CONNECTED = -5
      Charging state Error : SDConsts.SDResult.CHARGING_STATE_ERROR = -14
      Not Supported Error : SDConsts.SDResult.NOT_SUPPORTED_API = -36
      * Can receive other error constant of "SDResult" class.

    • SD_SetModeKeyEnable

    • BC_SetBarcodeMultiScanType

      public int BC_SetBarcodeMultiScanType(int BCMultiScanType)
      Enable/ Disable the MultiScan Type of BC barcode
      Specified by:
      BC_SetBarcodeMultiScanType in interface IBarcodeController
      Parameters:
      BCMultiScanType - 0 : DISABLE, 1 : ENABLE
      If Enable, you can read only multi number barcode.
      If Disable, you can read multi and single number barcode.
      Returns:
      Success : SDConsts.BCResult.SUCCESS = 0
      Argument Error : SDConsts.BCResult.ARGUMENT_ERROR = -3
      Serial Error : SDConsts.BCResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Condition Error : SDConsts.BCResult.READER_OR_COM_INTERFACE_STATUS_ERROR = -7
      Command State Error : SDConsts.BCResult.OTHER_CMD_RUNNING_ERROR = -4
      Other Errors : SDConsts.BCResult.OTHER_ERROR = -1
